alert.note: Alert for Weber (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 25 at 10:33PM MDT until May 29 at 12:00PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Utah... South Fork of The Ogden River Near Huntsville affecting Weber County. .Warm temperatures and upstream dam releases will continue to result in high river flows. For the South Fork of the Ogden River...including Huntsville...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY MONDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flows just below flood stage will continue * WHERE...South Fork of The Ogden River Near Huntsville. * WHEN...Until early Monday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 4.6 feet (992 CFS), low lying areas near the banks of the South Fork of the Ogden River below Causey Reservoir through the town of Huntsville will receive minor flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:15 PM MDT Thursday the stage was 4.5 feet (934 CFS). - Forecast...The river is expected to remain just below flood stage but above action stage of 4.4 ft (900 cfs) through next Monday. - Flood stage is 4.6 feet (992 cfs). &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Friday at 1200 PM MDT.
